14
15#ifndef ISCCFG_ACLCONF_H
16#define ISCCFG_ACLCONF_H 1
17
18#include <inttypes.h>
19
20#include <isc/lang.h>
21
22#include <isccfg/cfg.h>
23
24#ifdef HAVE_GEOIP
25#include <dns/geoip.h>
26#endif
27#include <dns/types.h>
28
29typedef struct cfg_aclconfctx {
30 ISC_LIST(dns_acl_t) named_acl_cache;
31 isc_mem_t *mctx;
32#ifdef HAVE_GEOIP
33 dns_geoip_databases_t *geoip;
34#endif
35 isc_refcount_t references;
36} cfg_aclconfctx_t;
37
38/***
39 *** Functions
40 ***/
41
42ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
43
44isc_result_t
45cfg_aclconfctx_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, cfg_aclconfctx_t **ret);
46/*
47 * Creates and initializes an ACL configuration context.
48 */
49
50void
51cfg_aclconfctx_detach(cfg_aclconfctx_t **actxp);
52/*
53 * Removes a reference to an ACL configuration context; when references
54 * reaches zero, clears the contents and deallocate the structure.
55 */
56
57void
58cfg_aclconfctx_attach(cfg_aclconfctx_t *src, cfg_aclconfctx_t **dest);
59/*
60 * Attaches a pointer to an existing ACL configuration context.
61 */
62
63isc_result_t
64cfg_acl_fromconfig(const cfg_obj_t *caml, const cfg_obj_t *cctx,
65 isc_log_t *lctx, cfg_aclconfctx_t *ctx,
66 isc_mem_t *mctx, unsigned int nest_level,
67 dns_acl_t **target);
68
69isc_result_t
70cfg_acl_fromconfig2(const cfg_obj_t *caml, const cfg_obj_t *cctx,
71 isc_log_t *lctx, cfg_aclconfctx_t *ctx,
72 isc_mem_t *mctx, unsigned int nest_level,
73 uint16_t family, dns_acl_t **target);
74/*
75 * Construct a new dns_acl_t from configuration data in 'caml' and
76 * 'cctx'. Memory is allocated through 'mctx'.
77 *
78 * Any named ACLs referred to within 'caml' will be be converted
79 * into nested dns_acl_t objects. Multiple references to the same
80 * named ACLs will be converted into shared references to a single
81 * nested dns_acl_t object when the referring objects were created
82 * passing the same ACL configuration context 'ctx'.
83 *
84 * cfg_acl_fromconfig() is a backward-compatible version of
85 * cfg_acl_fromconfig2(), which allows an address family to be
86 * specified. If 'family' is not zero, then only addresses/prefixes
87 * of a matching family (AF_INET or AF_INET6) may be configured.
88 *
89 * On success, attach '*target' to the new dns_acl_t object.
90 */
91
92ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
93
94#endif /* ISCCFG_ACLCONF_H */
95
